blocks.text:
Example 9—Find the value of $
\int \frac{dx}{\sqrt{x^4 + 1}}$ and hence the value of $
\int \frac{dx}{\sqrt{x^6 + 1}}$.
Dealing with the first of these—

blocks.latex: \int \frac{dx}{\sqrt{x^4 + 1}} = \int \frac{\sinh u \, du}{\sqrt{(\cosh^4 u) + 1}} = \int \frac{\sinh u \, du}{\sqrt{\cosh^4 u + 1}}.
blocks.description: This integral evaluates the expression involving hyperbolic sine and cosine.

blocks.text: To evaluate the second integral, let $x = \tan u$.

blocks.description: This shows the transformation of the integral from $x$ to $u$ in terms of tangent.

blocks.text:
Example 10—Find the value of $
\int \tan u \, du$ for the substitution in this case is—

blocks.description: This is the evaluation of the integral of tangent.
